description: Wendt determinant of n-th circulant matrix C(n).
comments: det(C(n))=0 for n divisible by 6.The determinant of the circulant matrix is 0 when 6 divides n because the polynomial (x+1)^(6k) - 1 has roots that are roots of unity. See A086569 for a generalization. - _T. D. Noe_, Jul 21 2003E. Lehmer claimed, and J. S. Frame proved, that 2^n - 1 divides  a(n) and the quotient abs(a(n))/(2^n - 1) is a perfect square (Ribenboim 1999, p. 128). - _Jonathan Sondow_, Aug 17 2012

formula: a(n) = 0 if and only if 6 divides n. If d divides n, then a(d) divides a(n). - _Michael Somos_, Apr 03 2007a(n) = (-1)^(n-1) * (2^n - 1) * A215615(n)^2. - _Jonathan Sondow_, Aug 17 2012a(2*n) = -3*A215616(n)^3. - _Jonathan Sondow_, Aug 18 2012
prog: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, 0, matdet( matrix( n, n, i, j, binomial( n, (j-i)%n ))))}
